text: applying a filter on a string in python
I have a user typing in his username and I only want valid strings to pass through, meaning only characters in [a-zA-Z0-9].
I am pretty new to python and unsure of the syntax.
Here's an example of what I want in code, which is to check through the username and return false upon a illegal character.

code:
def _checkInput(input):
     for char in input:
          if !(char in [a-zA-Z0-9]):
               return False
     return True
